page.title: 03Farming in the Tiverton Area
page.content: We made a survey of how the countryside in our D Block was being used. We viewed our whole area from its highest point near a place called Seven Crosses. We saw a variety of land uses: eg Pasture for Sheep and Cattle, Grassland for Hay and Sileage and crops such as Barley. We interviwed some farmers. They told us that because the land around Tiverton is fairly near moorland many of the fields are boggy and do not provide high quality pasture. The three main types of farming are Dairy, Beef and Sheep but a number of crops are harvested as well. We were told that the average price of farmland is about two thousand pounds an acre. This stops smaller farmers expanding. Another common complaint was that EEC Milk Quotas made it hard to keep profits up.
